title.value: Channel Selection for Test-Time Adaptation Under Distribution Shift
title.justification: The information comes directly from the provided research paper.
title.quote: Channel Selection for Test-Time Adaptation Under Distribution Shift

extractions.description: The paper discusses techniques to address the problem of label distribution shift in test-time adaptation (TTA), particularly with the use of batch normalization. The authors propose a method that selectively adapts channels in the network to improve model robustness.

type.justification: The paper includes experiments and results demonstrating the performance of the proposed method on benchmark datasets.
type.quote: We use two popular benchmarks datasets in our evaluations: CIFAR-10-C and ImageNet-1K-C.

name.justification: The research focuses on improving robustness and generalization of deep learning models through test-time adaptation techniques.
name.quote: To ensure robustness and generalization to real-world scenarios, test-time adaptation has been recently studied as an approach to adjust models to a new data distribution during inference.

name.justification: The paper evaluates the proposed method on benchmark datasets that are commonly used in Computer Vision research.
name.quote: We use two popular benchmarks datasets in our evaluations: CIFAR-10-C and ImageNet-1K-C.

name.justification: The paper specifically mentions training a Resnet-26 model for experiments.
name.quote: On CIFAR-10 we train a Resnet-26 model as defined in [23].

is_contributed.justification: Resnet-26 is not introduced as a new model in this paper; it is used for evaluation purposes.
is_contributed.quote: On CIFAR-10 we train a Resnet-26 model as defined in [23].

is_executed.justification: The model was trained and executed as part of the experiments mentioned in the paper.
is_executed.quote: On CIFAR-10 we train a Resnet-26 model as defined in [23].

is_compared.justification: The model's performance is compared with other models and baselines in the scope of the paper.
is_compared.quote: Adapted models significantly improve the performance compared to the baseline models and counteract unknown label shifts.

referenced_paper_title.value: Deep residual learning for image recognition
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper by Kaiming He et al., which introduced ResNet, is quoted in the research paper.

name.justification: The paper mentions using a pre-trained Resnet-18 model for experiments.
name.quote: For ImageNet-1K we use a pre-trained Resnet18 model.

is_contributed.justification: Resnet-18 is not a new contribution; it is an existing model used in their experiments.
is_contributed.quote: For ImageNet-1K we use a pre-trained Resnet18 model.

is_executed.justification: The model was executed as part of the experiments described in the paper.
is_executed.quote: For ImageNet-1K we use a pre-trained Resnet18 model.

is_compared.justification: The model's performance is compared with other models and baselines in the scope of the paper.
is_compared.quote: Adapted models significantly improve the performance compared to the baseline models and counteract unknown label shifts.
